intro: Ixora archboldii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ixora, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright orange-red inflorescences that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and elliptic in shape, often with a glossy texture. Ixora archboldii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests.
